results.title: Safety and efficacy of metformin in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus and chronic hepatitis C.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ may provide benefit in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Hepatitis_C</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006526 @@@HCV@@@ and in reducing the risk of @DISEASE_Carcinoma_Hepatocellular @DISEASE_MESH:D006528 @@@HCC@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2DM@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Hepatitis_C</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006526 @@@HCV@@@.

results.title: Diabetes and Hepatitis C: A Two-Way Association
results.text_hl: It remains to be determined whether the new curative therapies for @DISEASE_Hepatitis_C_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D019698 @@@chronic hepatitis C@@@ will improve outcomes in @DISEASE_Hepatitis_C_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D019698 @@@diabetic hepatitis C@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, and conversely whether treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ will reduce complications from @<m>DISEASE_Hepatitis_C</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006526 @@@hepatitis C virus infection@@@.

results.title: Improving treatment and liver fibrosis outcomes with metformin in HCV-HIV co-infected and HCV mono-infected patients with insulin resistance: study protocol for a randomized controlled trial
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ has been studied in both @<m>DISEASE_Hepatitis_C</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006526 @@@HCV@@@ and @DISEASE_HIV_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D015658 @@@HIV mono-infected@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with no increase in adverse events (AE).

results.title: Successful Withdrawal of Insulin Therapy After Post-Treatment Clearance of Hepatitis C Virus in a Man with Type 2 Diabetes
results.text_hl: He was started on @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ but progressed to multiple daily @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ injections after 3 years.

results.title: Interaction between hepatitis C virus and metabolic factors.
results.text_hl: While successful clinical management of @<m>DISEASE_Hepatitis_C</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006526 @@@HCV-infected@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Metabolic_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D008659 @@@metabolic disorders@@@ has also been achieved with some anti-@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ (i.e., @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@) and anti-@CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ (i.e., statins) medications, it is recommended that @CHEMICAL_Sulfonylurea_Compounds @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013453 @@@sulfonylurea@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Insulin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007328 @@@insulin@@@ be avoided.

citations.NLM: Kawaguchi Y, Mizuta T. Interaction between hepatitis C virus and metabolic factors. World J Gastroenterol. 2014 Mar 21;20(11):2888-901. PMID: 24659880
